item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Bell Hooks
item.description: "I still think it's important for people to have a sharp, ongoing critique of marriage in patriarchal society — because once you marry within a society that remains patriarchal, no matter how alternative you want to be within your unit, there is still a culture outside you that will impose many, many values on you whether you want them to or not. " -- Bell Hooks

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "Think of all the women you know who will not allow themselves to be seen without makeup. I often wonder how they feel about themselves at night when they are climbing into bed with intimate partners. Are they overwhelmed with secret shame that someone sees them as they really are? Or do they sleep with rage that who they really are can be celebrated or cared for only in secret?" -- bell hooks

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "There are times when personal experience keeps us from reaching the mountain top and so we let it go because the weight of it is too heavy. And sometimes the mountain top is difficult to reach with all our resources, factual and confessional, so we are just there, collectively grasping, feeling the limitations of knowledge, longing together, yearning for a way to reach that highest point. Even this yearning is a way to know." -- bell hooks

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "To love. To be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and the vulgar disparity of life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all, to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Sitting Bull
item.description: "Let us put our minds together and see what life we can make for our children." -- Sitting Bull

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Chief Joseph
item.description: "The earth is the mother of all people, and all people should have equal rights upon it." -- Chief Joseph

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Chief Joseph
item.description: "From where the sun now stands, I will fight no more, forever." -- Chief Joseph

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Chief Joseph
item.description: "It does not require many words to speak the truth." -- Chief Joseph

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Vandana Shiva
item.description: "In nature's economy the currency is not money, it is life." -- Vandana Shiva

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Wendy Rose
item.description: "I have always swung back and forth between alienation and relatedness. As a child, I would run away from the beatings, from the obscene words, and always knew that if I could run far enough, then any leaf, any insect, any bird, any breeze could bring me to my true home. I knew I did not belong among people. Whatever they hated about me was a human thing; the nonhuman world has always loved me. I can't remember when it was otherwise. But I have been emotionally crippled by this. There is nothing romantic about being young and angry, or even about turning that anger into art. I go through the motions of living in society, but never feel a part of it. When my family threw me away, every human on earth did likewise." -- Wendy Rose

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "But the true feminist deals out of a lesbian consciousness whether or not she ever sleeps with women." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Chief Seattle
item.description: "My people are few. They resemble the scattering trees of a storm-swept plain...There was a time when our people covered the land as the waves of a wind-ruffled sea cover its shell-paved floor, but that time long since passed away with the greatness of tribes that are now but a mournful memory." -- Chief Seattle

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "We have a lot of books in our house. They are our primary decorative motif-books in piles and on the coffee table, framed book covers, books sorted into stacks on every available surface, and of course books on shelves along most walls. Besides the visible books, there are books waiting in the wings, the basement books, the garage books, the storage locker books...They function as furniture, they prop up sagging fixtures and disguised by quilts function as tables...I can't imagine a home without an overflow of books. The point of books is to have way too many but to always feel you never have enough, or the right one at the right moment, but then sometimes to find you'd longed to fall asleep reading the Aspern Papers, and there it is." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Joy Harjo
item.description: "I know I walk in and out of several worlds each day." -- Joy Harjo

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "I will not have my life narrowed down. I will not bow down to somebody else's whim or to someone else's ignorance." -- bell hooks

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "Another world is not only possible, she is on her way. On a quiet day, I can hear her breathing." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Joy Harjo
item.description: "There is no poetry where there are no mistakes." -- Joy Harjo

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Joy Harjo
item.description: "True power does not amass through the pain and suffering of others." -- Joy Harjo

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "Being oppressed means the absence of choices" -- bell hooks

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Bell Hooks
item.description: "If I were really asked to define myself, I wouldn’t start with race; I wouldn’t start with blackness; I wouldn’t start with gender; I wouldn’t start with feminism. I would start with stripping down to what fundamentally informs my life, which is that I’m a seeker on the path. I think of feminism, and I think of anti-racist struggles as part of it. But where I stand spiritually is, steadfastly, on a path about love." -- Bell Hooks

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by bh
item.description: "I am passionate about everything in my life--first and foremost, passionate about ideas. And that's a dangerous person to be in this society, not just because I'm a woman, but because it's such a fundamentally anti-intellectual, anti-critical thinking society. --bell hooks" -- bh

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "But artists aren’t the only marginalized folks controlling real estate. Think about the colonizing role that wealthy white gay men have played in communities of color; they’re often the first group to gentrify poor and working-class neighborhoods. Harlem is a good example. Gays have moved in and driven up rents, as have renegade young white students, who want to be cool and hip. This is colonization, post-colonial-style. After all, the people who are “sent back” to recover the territory are always those who don’t mind associating with the colored people! And it’s a double bind, because some of these people could be allies. Some gay white men are proactive about racism, even while being entrepreneurial. But in the end, they take spaces, redo them, sell them for a certain amount of money, while the people who have been there are displaced. And in some cases, the people of color who are there are perceived as enemies by white newcomers." -- bell hooks

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "Reviewing the literature on love I noticed how few writers, male or female, talk about the impact of patriarchy, the way in which male domination of women and children stands in the ways of love." -- bell hooks
